description: A qualitative system of 12 cognitive perspectives (angles) for analyzing meaning emergence. Each perspective represents a different way of seeing/reading. There are no weights or hierarchies - all perspectives are always potentially present.
base_measurement_point: Mouse card (all perspectives in default layers A-L)
key_principle: Meaning arises in the interaction between text and reader. The framework maps possible reading positions.

perspectives.name: meta
perspectives.description: The frame of frames. Quantum view. System looking at itself. Abstract patterns, recursion, self-reference.
perspectives.layer_description: X - the unknown variable, framework itself

perspectives.name: linguistic
perspectives.description: Play with words, rhythm, ambiguity, double meanings. Language as material, performative speech acts.

perspectives.name: philosophical
perspectives.description: Existence, value, meaning, purpose. The 'why' questions. Ontology, epistemology, ethics.

perspectives.name: logical
perspectives.description: Structure, relationships, rules, deduction. Cause and effect, systems, order.

perspectives.name: psychological
perspectives.description: Emotions, motivations, inner states, projections. Character psychology, reader's emotional response.

perspectives.name: ironic
perspectives.description: Reversal, turning serious into ridiculous. Twist endings, subverted expectations, satire.

perspectives.name: associative
perspectives.description: Quick jumps between ideas, free connections. Stream of consciousness, dream logic, lateral thinking.

perspectives.name: metaphorical
perspectives.description: Translation between levels: symbol→meaning, meaning→image. Figurative language, allegory, representation.

perspectives.name: paradoxical
perspectives.description: Contradictory meanings coexisting. Logical paradoxes, impossible statements, cognitive dissonance.

perspectives.name: absurd
perspectives.description: Logic turned inside out, connecting the unconnectable. Nonsense, surrealism, illogical connections.

perspectives.name: naive
perspectives.description: Childlike direct logic, observation without filters. Simple questions, literal reading, unframed perception.

perspectives.name: cultural
perspectives.description: Archetypes, traditions, cultural codes, memory. Intertextuality, references, collective patterns.

layer_system.purpose: Layers (A-L) indicate qualitative deviation from the base measurement point (Mouse card). When a perspective appears in a different layer than its base layer, it shows transformation of that perspective in a particular context.
layer_system.example: In the Cat story, the linguistic perspective (b) appears in the ACTION layer (F) because language becomes physical action (burping dots).
